Text saved: Sam looked towards the sun at the distant cloud of dust which the car was making on its way to the Big House. The horses kicked and moved their tails because of the flies, and they did not seem to care that this was their owner's first visit in ten months. Sam waited. Mr Carter only came out here when he had to, which was fine with Sam because he knew that if he avoided his boss, he would keep his job for longer. Mr Carter wiped the sweat from the back of his neck, and the wet spots on his shirt joined together like shapes on a map. His skin was already turning red in the June sun, although he usually had the skin colour of a man who made money while other people did the work.
